page.title: 14INTERVIEW WITH CELEBRITY
page.content: Another interesting gentleman in Doune is{Mr William Mcleod}who retired this year as janitor of our school. He has lived in Doune all his life and says studying the history of the village is his favourite hobby. He was born in 1920 and apart from working in the area around Doune has never been far from the village. At school he says his teachers were strict but fair. Boys enjoyed football, marbles and swimming in the Teith in the summer; girls played ball and skipping games. As a young lad of 14 he started work as a gardener, then later changed to gamekeeping. This work suited him as he loves all birds and animals, and he could study plants and trees at the same time. He worked as janitor for many years and was always willing to guide us round the village.
